Hi @mralext20, KSP uses the proprietary calibri font, if this is unavailable it will use the proprietary Arial and Arial Bold fonts, these are the default fallback fonts of the Unity game engine.

These are installed by default in Windows, OSX and in Ubuntu and its derivatives, but are not installed in most other distros.

They are awkward to obtain, but you can find the correct versions of Arial that Unity needs in the winetricks EUfonts pack.

Other than that you can try the Arch equivalent of the ttf-mscorefonts-installer package.

But your picture shows me that fonts were found, as you have text in the description box, what you don't have are the buttons for the scenarios or the banners, like this:

I think you need to reinstall and check again.
The best workaround for this I know of on Arch is to not use the real screen size, cut it to 1280x720 or something.

I've figured out a 'workaround'

 

This appears to only be a bug on the prerelease: I reverted to stable and the bug went away.

Except it's working in the Linux pre-release, the pic I posted is from the 1196 pre-release build on Xubuntu Linux, running proprietary Nvidia drivers.

So it's likely the bug is not in the game and could be a bad install or a graphics driver issue, meaning you're going to be disappointed when 1.1 is released properly and this issue is still there.
